subject: Re: [junit] Test  Dependencies
msgSnippet: One solution to consider is to use mock objects. You can try one of the mocking frameworks, i.e jmock. Ilya ... [Non-text portions of this message have been
messageBody:
One solution to consider is to use "mock" objects. You can try one of
the mocking frameworks, i.e jmock.

Ilya

Arash Bijanzadeh wrote:
>
> I have a problem with the test dependencies. The application is a
> database backed application and I want to test the db functionality.
> For this purpose, first thing to be done is database populating which
> itself is a test suite. Is there any way to specify the order or tests
> in Junit? Or any other solution which suits this kind of scenarios?
> Thanks in advance,
> Arash
>
>
